verses.verse: It happened in the month <S%H2320><s%> Nisan, <S%H5212><s%> in the twentieth <S%H6242><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Artaxerxes <S%H783><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> when wine <S%H3196><s%> was before <S%H6440><s%> him, <S%H5375><s%> that I took up the wine, <S%H3196><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> it to the king. <S%H4428><s%> Now I had not been sad <S%H7451><s%> before in his presence. <S%H6440><s%>

The king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H6440><s%> "Why is your face sad, <S%H7451><s%> since you are not sick? <S%H2470><s%> This is nothing else but sorrow <S%H7455><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>" Then I was very <S%H3966><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> afraid. <S%H3372><s%>

I said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> "Let the king <S%H4428><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> forever! <S%H5769><s%> Why shouldn't <S%H6440><s%> my face be sad, <S%H3415><s%> when the city, <S%H5892><s%> the place <S%H1004><s%> of my fathers <S%H1><s%>' tombs, <S%H6913><s%> lies waste, <S%H2720><s%> and its gates <S%H8179><s%> have been consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire? <S%H784><s%>"
Then the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H1245><s%> "For what do you make request?" So I prayed <S%H6419><s%> to the God <S%H430><s%> of heaven. <S%H8064><s%>

I said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> "If it pleases <S%H2895><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> and if your servant <S%H5650><s%> has found favor <S%H3190><s%> in your sight, <S%H6440><s%> that you would send <S%H7971><s%> me to Judah, <S%H3063><s%> to the city <S%H5892><s%> of my fathers <S%H1><s%>' tombs, <S%H6913><s%> that I may build it. <S%H1129><s%>"

The king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me <S%H7694><s%> (the queen was also sitting <S%H3427><s%> by him <S%H681><s%>), "For how long shall your journey <S%H4109><s%> be? <S%H7725><s%> And when will you return?" So it pleased <S%H3190><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> to send <S%H7971><s%> me; <S%H5414><s%> and I set him a time. <S%H2165><s%>

Moreover I said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> "If it pleases <S%H2895><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> let letters <S%H107><s%> be given <S%H5414><s%> me to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the River, <S%H5104><s%> that they may let me pass through <S%H5674><s%> until I come <S%H935><s%> to Judah; <S%H3063><s%>

and a letter <S%H107><s%> to Asaph <S%H623><s%> the keeper <S%H8104><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%>'s forest, <S%H6508><s%> that he may give <S%H5414><s%> me timber <S%H6086><s%> to make beams <S%H7136><s%> for the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the citadel <S%H1002><s%> by the temple, <S%H1004><s%> for the wall <S%H2346><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and for the house <S%H1004><s%> that I shall enter into. <S%H935><s%>" The king <S%H4428><s%> granted <S%H5414><s%> my requests, <S%H2896><s%> because of the good hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God on me. <S%H430><s%>

Then I came <S%H935><s%> to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the River, <S%H5104><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> them the king <S%H4428><s%>'s letters. <S%H107><s%> Now the king <S%H4428><s%> had sent <S%H7971><s%> with me captains <S%H8269><s%> of the army <S%H2428><s%> and horsemen. <S%H6571><s%>

When Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite, <S%H2772><s%> and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant, <S%H5650><s%> the Ammonite, <S%H5984><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of it, <S%H3415><s%> it grieved them exceedingly, <S%H7451><s%> because a man <S%H120><s%> had come <S%H935><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> the welfare <S%H2896><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
So I came <S%H935><s%> to Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and was there three <S%H7969><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

I arose <S%H6965><s%> in the night, <S%H3915><s%> I and some <S%H4592><s%> few <S%H4592><s%> men <S%H582><s%> with me; <S%H5046><s%> neither told I any man <S%H582><s%> what my God <S%H430><s%> put <S%H5414><s%> into my heart <S%H3820><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> for Jerusalem; <S%H3389><s%> neither was there any animal <S%H929><s%> with me, <S%H929><s%> except the animal that I rode on. <S%H7392><s%>

I went out <S%H3318><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%> by the valley <S%H1516><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> even toward <S%H6440><s%> the jackal <S%H8577><s%>'s well, <S%H5869><s%> and to the dung <S%H830><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the walls <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> which were broken down, <S%H6555><s%> and its gates <S%H8179><s%> were consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire. <S%H784><s%>

Then I went on <S%H5674><s%> to the spring <S%H5869><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%> and to the king <S%H4428><s%>'s pool: <S%H1295><s%> but there was no place <S%H4725><s%> for the animal <S%H929><s%> that was under me to pass. <S%H5674><s%>

Then went I up <S%H5927><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%> by the brook, <S%H5158><s%> and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the wall; <S%H2346><s%> and I turned back, <S%H7725><s%> and entered <S%H935><s%> by the valley <S%H1516><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> and so returned. <S%H7725><s%>

The rulers <S%H5461><s%> didn't <S%H3045><s%> know where I went, <S%H1980><s%> or what I did; <S%H6213><s%> neither had I as yet <S%H3651><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> it to the Jews, <S%H3064><s%> nor to the priests, <S%H3548><s%> nor to the nobles, <S%H2715><s%> nor to the rulers, <S%H5461><s%> nor to the rest <S%H3499><s%> who did <S%H6213><s%> the work. <S%H4399><s%>

Then I said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H7200><s%> "You see the evil <S%H7451><s%> case that we are in, <S%H3389><s%> how Jerusalem lies waste, <S%H2720><s%> and its gates <S%H8179><s%> are burned <S%H3341><s%> with fire. <S%H784><s%> Come, <S%H3212><s%> let us build up <S%H1129><s%> the wall <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> that we won't <S%H2781><s%> be disgraced."

I told <S%H5046><s%> them of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%> which was good <S%H2896><s%> on me, <S%H4428><s%> as also of the king's words <S%H1697><s%> that he had spoken <S%H559><s%> to me. <S%H559><s%> They said, "Let <S%H6965><s%>'s rise up and build. <S%H1129><s%>" So they strengthened <S%H2388><s%> their hands <S%H3027><s%> for the good work. <S%H2896><s%>

But when Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite, <S%H2772><s%> and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant, <S%H5650><s%> the Ammonite, <S%H5984><s%> and Geshem <S%H1654><s%> the Arabian, <S%H6163><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> it, <S%H3932><s%> they ridiculed us, <S%H959><s%> and despised us, <S%H559><s%> and said, "What is this thing <S%H1697><s%> that you are doing? <S%H6213><s%> Will you rebel <S%H4775><s%> against the king? <S%H4428><s%>"

Then answered <S%H7725><s%> I them, <S%H559><s%> and said to them, <S%H430><s%> "The God of heaven <S%H8064><s%> will prosper <S%H6743><s%> us. <S%H5650><s%> Therefore we, his servants, will arise <S%H6965><s%> and build; <S%H1129><s%> but you have no portion, <S%H2506><s%> nor right, <S%H6666><s%> nor memorial, <S%H2146><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>"
